definition: poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: Writing poems was a ritual to express individual's political ideal and ambition in the Spring-and-Autumn Period.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代，赋诗是政治理想与个人志向的表达方式。

sentences.english: Chinese Foreign Minister Li Zhaoxing once composed a poem at Cabo da Roca.
sentences.chinese: 中国的外交部长李肇星曾经在罗卡角赋诗一首。

sentences.english: Seeing such beautiful scenery, I really want to compose a poem.
sentences.chinese: 看到这么美的景色，我真想赋诗一首。

sentences.english: The famous poet was often asked to compose a poem extempore.
sentences.chinese: 这位著名的诗人常被邀请即席赋诗。

sentences.english: The intonation of poems and quoting poems in the Spring and Autumn period were a special culture phenomenon of Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 春秋“赋诗引诗”，是中国史上一种特殊的文化现象。

sentences.english: At that time, a Shaohuo Monk "-'word for that, given Shiyi Shou ."
sentences.chinese: 当时，有一烧火僧以“半’字为题，赋诗一首。

sentences.english: She's very creative—she writes poetry and paints.
sentences.chinese: 她极富创造力，既赋诗又作画。

sentences.english: "Allusion" is a common rhetoric device in composing poetry and prose.
sentences.chinese: 赋诗是春秋时期一种特殊的活动和文化现象。

definition: to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
while in high spirits/feeling upbeat/on an impulse
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
